alert.note: Alert for Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 25 at 4:28AM CST until February 25 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Harpeth River At Franklin affecting Williamson County. For the Harpeth River...including Franklin...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Harpeth River At Franklin. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Flooding will affect areas along the Harpeth River from Franklin to Bellevue. In Franklin, water will reach the city park, 4th Street, and portions of Highway 431. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM CST Friday the stage was 24.7 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 7.3 feet Tuesday evening. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1200 PM CST.
